head.title: kcgi | minimal CGI library for C

body.header:
kcgi — minimal CGI library for C
version @VERSION@ Sources Archives

article.p: kcgi is a minimal CGI library for web applications (HTML and HTTP) in ISO C. It was designed to be simple, ISC licensed, and auditable. See a Comparison of CGI Libraries in C for alternatives. To start, download kcgi.tgz and run make install into your PREFIX of choice. The kcgi(3) manpage documents all function, variables, types, and general usage. kcgi is a BSD.lv project.
The following is a rough feature list of kcgi. See the manual for details.

ul.li: query string, cookie, and form (multipart and urlencoded) input
lightweight functions for building HTML5 trees and HTTP headers
safe memory allocation functions (inspired by OpenSSH)

article.p: Most kcgi applications work as follows:

ol.li: Emit any HTTP headers with khttp_head.
Use HTML builder functions (khtml_elem etc.), the khtml_template template system, or directly output (khttp_puts etc.) for generating body content.
Close and free HTTP context with khttp_free.

article.p: Recognise HTTP authentication methods in struct kreq. Add fullpath and clarify path members of struct kreq. Add kasprintf as a wrapper for asprintf.
